objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) is the author and publisher of this report, providing analysis and detection rules for Infinite Second.

objects.name: WSqmCons registry value
objects.description: Registry value used by Infinite Second to store the obfuscated PowerShell script payload.

objects.name: N registry value
objects.description: Registry value used to store the hardcoded 3DES password for PowerSploit script decryption.

objects.name: S registry value
objects.description: Registry value used to store the hardcoded 3DES salt for PowerSploit script decryption.

objects.name: WSqmConBin registry value
objects.description: Registry value used to store the backup path of the Microsoft Consolidator executable.

objects.name: ChannelReferences registry key
objects.description: Registry key used to store configuration for PowerSploit decryption (password and salt values).

objects.name: WSqmConHex registry value
objects.description: Registry value used to store backup arguments for the Microsoft Consolidator executable.

objects.name: WSqmConBak registry value
objects.description: Registry value used to store backup configuration for the Microsoft Consolidator scheduled task.

objects.name: tmp4071.tmp
objects.description: File deleted by Infinite Second, likely an artefact of a parent component or used for defense evasion.

objects.name: thumbs.ini
objects.description: File executed and then deleted by Infinite Second, likely a malicious PowerShell script.

objects.name: Indicator for Infinite Second PowerShell script (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the malicious Infinite Second PowerShell dropper used to deploy ComRAT.

objects.name: Indicator for Infinite Second PowerShell script (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the malicious Infinite Second PowerShell dropper used to deploy ComRAT.

objects.name: Indicator for Infinite Second PowerShell script (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the malicious Infinite Second PowerShell dropper used to deploy ComRAT.

objects.name: Indicator for Script stored in registry (Base64 encoded) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the Infinite Second PowerShell script as stored in the registry (Base64 encoded).

objects.name: Indicator for Script stored in registry (Base64 encoded) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the Infinite Second PowerShell script as stored in the registry (Base64 encoded).

objects.name: Indicator for Script stored in registry (Base64 encoded) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the Infinite Second PowerShell script as stored in the registry (Base64 encoded).

objects.name: Indicator for Script stored in registry (decoded) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the Infinite Second PowerShell script as stored in the registry (decoded).

objects.name: Indicator for Script stored in registry (decoded) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the Infinite Second PowerShell script as stored in the registry (decoded).

objects.name: Indicator for Script stored in registry (decoded) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the Infinite Second PowerShell script as stored in the registry (decoded).

objects.name: Indicator for Modified PowerSploit Invoke-ReflectivePEInjection script (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the maliciously modified PowerSploit script used for reflective PE injection.

objects.name: Indicator for Modified PowerSploit Invoke-ReflectivePEInjection script (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the maliciously modified PowerSploit script used for reflective PE injection.

objects.name: Indicator for Modified PowerSploit Invoke-ReflectivePEInjection script (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the maliciously modified PowerSploit script used for reflective PE injection.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload (x86) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the 32-bit ComRAT DLL payload dropped by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload (x86) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the 32-bit ComRAT DLL payload dropped by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload (x86) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the 32-bit ComRAT DLL payload dropped by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload (x64) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the 64-bit ComRAT DLL payload dropped by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload (x64) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the 64-bit ComRAT DLL payload dropped by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload (x64) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the 64-bit ComRAT DLL payload dropped by Infinite Second.

objects.name: infinite second
objects.description: Infinite Second is a malicious PowerShell script used to drop the ComRAT malware. It employs multiple layers of obfuscation, including XOR and 3DES, and modifies the scheduled task of the Microsoft Consolidator (part of the Customer Experience Improvement Program) to achieve persistence on user log-in. The script stores configuration and payloads in the registry, uses a modified PowerSploit Invoke-ReflectivePEInjection script to inject ComRAT into the explorer process, and employs various defense evasion techniques such as masquerading registry values and deleting temporary files.

objects.name: comrat
objects.description: ComRAT (also referred to as Chinch) is a Windows DLL payload dropped by Infinite Second. It is injected into the explorer process using a modified PowerSploit script. The payload is stored in the registry in an obfuscated form and is deobfuscated and executed in-memory. ComRAT is well documented in open-source reporting and is beyond the scope of this report.

objects.name: Microsoft
objects.description: Microsoft is referenced as the vendor of the Windows operating system and the Microsoft Consolidator scheduled task, which is hijacked by Infinite Second for persistence.

objects.name: infinitesecond_custom_xor
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_custom_xor
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies the XOR implementation"

    strings:
      $a =
"KGJ5dGVbXSBpbmNvbWVfYnl0ZXMsIGJ5dGVbXSBnYW1tYSl7Ynl0ZVtdIG91dHB1dCA9IG5l
 dyBieXRlW2luY29tZV9ieXRlcy5MZW5ndGhdO2ZvciAoaW50IGkgPSAwOyBpIDwgaW5jb21lX
 2J5dGVzLkxlbmd0aDsgKytpKXtvdXRwdXRbaV0gPSAoYnl0ZSkoaW5jb21lX2J5dGVzW2ldIF
 4gZ2FtbWFbaSAlIGdhbW1hLkxlbmd0aF0pO31yZXR1cm4gb3V0cHV0O319"

$b =

"hieXRlW10gaW5jb21lX2J5dGVzLCBieXRlW10gZ2FtbWEpe2J5dGVbXSBvdXRwdXQgPSBuZX
 cgYnl0ZVtpbmNvbWVfYnl0ZXMuTGVuZ3RoXTtmb3IgKGludCBpID0gMDsgaSA8IGluY29tZV9
 ieXRlcy5MZW5ndGg7ICsraSl7b3V0cHV0W2ldID0gKGJ5dGUpKGluY29tZV9ieXRlc1tpXSBe
 IGdhbW1hW2kgJSBnYW1tYS5MZW5ndGhdKTt9cmV0dXJuIG91dHB1dDt9f"

$c =

"oYnl0ZVtdIGluY29tZV9ieXRlcywgYnl0ZVtdIGdhbW1hKXtieXRlW10gb3V0cHV0ID0gbmV
 3IGJ5dGVbaW5jb21lX2J5dGVzLkxlbmd0aF07Zm9yIChpbnQgaSA9IDA7IGkgPCBpbmNvbWVf
 Ynl0ZXMuTGVuZ3RoOyArK2kpe291dHB1dFtpXSA9IChieXRlKShpbmNvbWVfYnl0ZXNbaV0gX
 iBnYW1tYVtpICUgZ2FtbWEuTGVuZ3RoXSk7fXJldHVybiBvdXRwdXQ7fX"
    condition:
        any of them
}

objects.name: infinitesecond_random_name_function
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_random_name_function
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies the random name generator"

    strings:
        $ = "function TVM730egf([string[]]$GP50afa) { $UC33gfa =
((1..(Get-Random -Min 2 -Max 4) | % {[Char](Get-Random -Min 0x41 -Max
0x5B)}) -join '');"
        $ = "$EQ33abh = ((1..(Get-Random -Min 2 -Max 4) | % {[Char](Get-
Random -Min 0x30 -Max 0x3A)}) -join '');"
        $ = "$OFK689fa = ((1..(Get-Random -Min 2 -Max 4) | % {[Char](Get-
Random -Min 0x61 -Max 0x6B)}) -join '');"
    condition: any of them
}

objects.name: infinitesecond_hardcoded_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_hardcoded_strings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies hardcoded strings throughout the
script"

    strings:
        $ = "HKLM:\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\SQMClient\\Windows"
        $ =
"\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\WINEVT\\Publishers\\{cab
e18a5-69b9-4eec-bed0-fa080ed05a3b}\\ChannelReferences\\0"
        $ = "C:\\Windows\\Temp\\tmp4071.tmp"
        $ = "C:\\Windows\\System32\\Tasks\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Customer
Experience Improvement Program\\Consolidator"
        $ = "Microsoft\\Windows\\Customer Experience Improvement Program"
        $ = "WSqmConHex"
        $ = "WSqmConBin"
        $ = "WSqmCons"
        $ = "WSqmConBak"

    condition: 4 of them
}

objects.name: infinitesecond_3des_file
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_3des_file
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "3DES Initialisation Vector"

    strings:

$IV = "FVADRCORAOSKBHPX"

    condition:
        all of them
}

objects.name: infinitesecond_psbreakpoint_luis_armstrong
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_psbreakpoint_luis_armstrong
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identification of unusual PowerShell break point"

    strings:
        $  = "Set-PSBreakpoint -Variable luis_armstrong -Mode Write;"
wide ascii
    condition:
        all of them
}

objects.name: infinitesecond_powershell_reflective_injection
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_powershell_reflective_injection
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies a modification made to reflective
injection script"

    strings:

$process_number = {7b 54 68 72 6f 77 20 22 43 61 6e 27 74 20

66 69 6e 64 20 70 72 6f 63 65 73 73 20 24 50 72 6f 63 4e 61 6d 65 22 7d
65 6c 73 65 7b 24 50 72 6f 63 49 64 20 3d 20 24 50 72 6f 63 65 73 73 65
73 5b 30 5d 2e 49 44 7d 7d} // {Throw "Can't find process
$ProcName"}else{$ProcId = $Processes[0].ID}}

condition:

all of them

}

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: PowerShell
objects.description: Infinite Second is a PowerShell script that deploys and sets up persistence for ComRAT.

objects.name: Scheduled Task/Job: Scheduled Task
objects.description: Infinite Second creates or modifies a scheduled task to run as SYSTEM to launch ComRAT.

objects.name: Modify Registry
objects.description: Infinite Second stores cryptographic keys, additional scripts and obfuscated payloads in the registry.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: Infinite Second deobfuscates information stored in the registry using 3DES, XOR, and Base64 encoding.

objects.name: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location
objects.description: Infinite Second uses registry values that masquerade as legitimate software.

objects.name: Indicator Removal on Host: File Deletion
objects.description: Infinite Second deletes C:\Windows\Temp\tmp4071.tmp and C:\Users\Public\Documents\thumbs.ini.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Infinite Second
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. infinite second.
